member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.Colorizer
member.summary: This class implements the interface and is used to support syntax highlighting in an editor.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.Colorizer.#ctor(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.LanguageService,Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextManager.Interop.IVsTextLines,Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.IScanner)
member.summary: Initializes the class.
member.param: [in] The language service.
[in] The object that serves as the buffer for the colorizer.
[in] The object that handles all parsing operations associated with syntax highlighting.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.Colorizer.CloseColorizer
member.summary: Called when the colorizer is disposed of.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.Colorizer.ColorizeLine(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.UInt32[])
member.summary: Obtains color and font attribute information for each character in the specified line of text.
member.returns: Returns the updated state value.
member.param: [in] The line number from which the line of text came from.
[in] The number of characters in the given text.
[in] An unmarshaled pointer to a line of text.
[in] The current state as maintained by the parser.
[in, out] An array that is filled in with indices into the list as maintained by the class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.Colorizer.Dispose
member.summary: Disposes the object.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.Colorizer.Finalize
member.summary: Called when the object is about to be destroyed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.Colorizer.GetColorInfo(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the parsing state at the end of the line without returning any colorization information.
member.returns: Returns the parsing state at the end of the line.
member.param: [in] The text of the line.
[in] The length of the line.
[in] The initial parsing state of the line.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.Colorizer.GetLineInfo(Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextManager.Interop.IVsTextLines,System.Int32,Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextManager.Interop.IVsTextColorState)
member.summary: Returns color information about the specified line.
member.returns: If successful, returns an array of objects describing each token on the line; otherwise, returns a null value.
member.param: [in] An object containing the entire source file.
[in] The index of the line for which to get color information.
[in] An object from which cached state information can be obtained for a line.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.Colorizer.GetStartState(System.Int32@)
member.summary: Returns the initial parsing state.
member.returns: If successful, returns ; otherwise, returns an error code.
member.param: [out] Returns the initial parsing state.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.Colorizer.GetStateAtEndOfLine(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.IntPtr,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the parsing state at the end of the specified line.
member.returns: Returns the parsing state at the end of the line.
member.param: [in] The line number from where the text came from.
[in] The length of the text to examine.
[in] An unmarshaled pointer to the text. The example in shows how to marshal this pointer to a string.
[in] The parsing state at the beginning of the line.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.Colorizer.GetStateMaintenanceFlag(System.Int32@)
member.summary: Called to determine if the colorizer requires per line state management.
member.returns: If successful, returns ; otherwise, returns an error code.
member.param: [out] Returns nonzero if the colorizer requires parsing state to be tracked per line; otherwise, returns zero.

member.summary: Called to resume use of the colorizer.

member.summary: Returns the scanner being used.
member.returns: Returns an object.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.Colorizer.Suspend
member.summary: Called to suspend use of the colorizer.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.CompletionSet

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: [in] An object containing the images to be used in the completion list display. This cannot be null. It can however, be an empty list..
[in] A object representing the source file to be affected by the completion list. This cannot be null.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.CompletionSet.Close
member.summary: Closes the completion list display.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.CompletionSet.CompareItems(System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Compares two strings for the specified number of characters.
member.returns: If the method is successful, returns ; otherwise, returns an error code (in which case the default comparison is used).
member.param: The first string to compare.
The second string to compare.
The number of characters to compare.
[out] The result of the comparison.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.CompletionSet.Declarations
member.summary: Gets or sets the object this completion set uses.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.CompletionSet.DecreaseFilterLevel(System.Int32)
member.summary: Changes the level of the internal filter list and updates it, showing common items.
member.returns: If the method succeeds, it returns . If it fails, it returns an error code.
member.param: The index of the item that is currently selected.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.CompletionSet.Dismiss
member.summary: Called when the completion list is no longer needed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.CompletionSet.Dispose
member.summary: Deallocates any resources just before the object is destroyed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.CompletionSet.GetBestMatch(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32@,System.UInt32@)
member.summary: Determines which item in the list is the best match for the text typed so far by the user.
member.returns: If successful, returns ; otherwise, returns an error code.
member.param: [in] The text that has been typed by the user.
[in] The length of the text typed by the user.
[out] Returns the index of the item in the object that best matches the typed text.
[out] Returns a set of flags from the enumeration.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.CompletionSet.GetCompletionItemColor(System.Int32,System.UInt32@,System.UInt32@)
member.summary: Gets the foreground and background colors for a selected item.
member.returns: If the method succeeds, it returns if there are colors set, S_FALSE if the defaults are used. If it fails, it returns an error code.
member.param: The index of the item for which to get the colors.
[out] Returns the foreground color.
[out] Returns the background color.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.CompletionSet.GetCount
member.summary: Gets the number of items that can be displayed in the completion list.
member.returns: The number of items to be displayed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.CompletionSet.GetDescriptionText(System.Int32,System.String@)
member.summary: Gets a description for the specified item in the completion list.
member.returns: If successful, returns ; otherwise, returns an error.
member.param: [in] The index of the item for which to get a description.
[out] Returns the description, or null if there is no description.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.CompletionSet.GetDisplayText(System.Int32,System.String@,System.Int32[])
member.summary: Gets the text and image index to display in the completion list for the specified item.
member.returns: If successful, returns ; otherwise, returns an error code.
member.param: [in] The index of the item for which to get the display text and image.
[out] Returns the display text, or null if there is no display text.
[in, out] Returns the index of the image to display, or -1 if no image is to be displayed. This parameter can be null, indicating the caller does not want the image index.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.CompletionSet.GetFilterLevel(System.Int32@)
member.summary: Gets the current filter level.
member.returns: If successful, returns . If there is no filter, returns ; otherwise, returns an error code.
member.param: [out] Returns the filter level.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.CompletionSet.GetFlags
member.summary: Gets a set of flags specifying the behavior of the completion list.
member.returns: A set of flags from the enumeration; specifically, from the CSF_* group.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.CompletionSet.GetImageList(System.IntPtr@)
member.summary: Returns the image list to use for the glyphs in the completion list.
member.returns: If successful, returns ; otherwise, returns an error code.
member.param: [out] Returns the handle to an image list.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.CompletionSet.GetInitialExtent(System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Gets the initial extent of the text to be completed.
member.returns: If successful, returns ; otherwise, returns an error code.
member.param: [out] Returns the line number the text is on.
[out] Returns the character offset of the first character of the text.
[out] Returns the character offset of the last character of the text.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.CompletionSet.IncreaseFilterLevel(System.Int32)
member.summary: Show in the completion list the members of the specified type.
member.returns: If the method succeeds, it returns . If it fails, it returns an error code.
member.param: The index of the selected item.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.CompletionSet.Init(Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextManager.Interop.IVsTextView,Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.Declarations,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes the completion set object.
member.param: [in] An object representing the view that displays the source file.
[in] A object that manages the list of declarations to show in the completion list.

[in] true if part of a word is to be completed, otherwise false (the user selected Complete Word from the IntelliSense menu with the caret not positioned immediately after any text. This displays all possible completions).

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.CompletionSet.IsCommitted
member.summary: Gets whether any text has been committed to the source file.
member.returns: true if text has been committed to the source file, otherwise false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.CompletionSet.IsDisplayed
member.summary: Gets whether the completion list is currently displayed.
member.returns: Set to true if the completion list is displayed, otherwise false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.CompletionSet.OnAutoComplete
member.summary: Called after completion text has been committed to the source file.
member.returns: A character to be inserted after the committed text, or 0 if no character is to be inserted.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.CompletionSet.OnCommit(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.UInt16,System.String@)
member.summary: Gets the text to be inserted into the source file if the specified character is a commit character.
member.returns: If successful, returns . If the parameter is not a commit character, returns (do not commit the text to the source file); otherwise, returns an error code.
member.param: [in] A string containing the text that has been typed so far by the user.
[in] The index of the item in the completion list that is currently selected.
[in] Nonzero if an item is selected in the completion list (the index of the selected item is in the parameter). If this parameter is zero, the parameter is to be ignored.
[in] The typed character that triggered the completion list.
[out] Returns the string to insert in the source.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.CompletionSet.OnCommitComplete
member.summary: Called after the text has been committed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.CompletionSet.OnCommitText
member.summary: Gets the text that is to be committed to the source file.
member.returns: The text if there is anything to commit, otherwise null.

member.summary: Moves the internal caret position the specified number of positions to the right.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.Methods
member.summary: Represents a collection of method signatures obtained from a parsing operation in a language service.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.Methods.#ctor
member.summary: When implemented in a derived class, initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.Methods.CloseBracket
member.summary: Gets the character to use at the end of a method parameter list.
member.returns: The character to use at the end of a parameter list.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.Methods.DefaultMethod
member.summary: Gets the index of the initial method signature to show.
member.returns: The index of the first method signature to show the user when the IntelliSense method tip is displayed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.Methods.Delimiter
member.summary: Gets the character that separates parameters in a method's parameter list.
member.returns: The parameter list separator.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.Methods.GetCount
member.summary: When implemented in a derived class, gets the number of overloaded method signatures represented in this collection.
member.returns: The number of signatures in the collection.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.Methods.GetDescription(System.Int32)
member.summary: When implemented in a derived class, gets the description of the specified method signature.
member.returns: The description of the specified method signature, or null if the method signature does not exist.
member.param: [in] An index into the internal list to the desired method signature.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.Methods.GetName(System.Int32)
member.summary: When implemented in a derived class, gets the name of the specified method signature.
member.returns: The name of the specified method, or null.
member.param: [in] The index of the method whose name is to be returned.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.Methods.GetParameterCount(System.Int32)
member.summary: When implemented in a derived class, gets the number of parameters on the specified method signature.
member.returns: The number of parameters on the specified method signature, or -1.
member.param: [in] An index into the list of method signatures.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.Methods.GetParameterInfo(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String@,System.String@,System.String@)
member.summary: When implemented in a derived class, gets information about the specified parameter on the specified method signature.
member.param: [in] An index into the list of method signatures.
[in] An index into the parameter list of the specified method signature.
[out] Returns the name of the parameter.
[out] Returns the parameter name and type formatted for display.
[out] Returns a string containing a description of the parameter.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.Methods.GetType(System.Int32)
member.summary: When implemented in a derived class, gets the return type of the specified method signature.
member.returns: The return type of the specified method signature, or null.
member.param: [in] An index into the list of method signatures.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.Methods.OpenBracket
member.summary: Gets the character to use at the start of a method's parameter list.
member.returns: The character to use at the start of a parameter list.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.Methods.TypePostfix
member.summary: Gets the string to place after the return type of a method.
member.returns: The string to use after a method's type.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.Methods.TypePrefix
member.summary: Gets the string to place before the return type of a method.
member.returns: The string to place before a method's return type.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.Methods.TypePrefixed
member.summary: Gets whether a method's return type comes before or after the method signature.
member.returns: true if the type precedes the method's signature, false if the type follows the method's signature.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.ParseReason
member.summary: Provides reasons for a parsing operation in a language service.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.ParseReason.None
member.summary: A placeholder value indicating that no parsing should be done.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.ParseReason.MemberSelect
member.summary: Parse the separator character before the current location to obtain a list of members for the class.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.ParseReason.HighlightBraces
member.summary: Parse to find the matching language pairs (such as "{" and "}" or "<" and ">") that enclose the given location so they and their contents can be highlighted.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.ParseReason.MemberSelectAndHighlightBraces
member.summary: Parse the character at the current location to complete a member selection and to highlight the matching pair to the parsed character (such as a ")" after a method name).

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.ParseReason.MatchBraces
member.summary: Parse the language pair at the given location to finds its match.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.ParseReason.Check
member.summary: Parse the entire source file, checking for errors. This pass should also create lists of matching language pairs, triplets, members, and methods.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.ParseReason.CompleteWord
member.summary: Parse to get the partially completed word before the current position in order to show a list of possible completions (members, arguments, methods).

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.ParseReason.DisplayMemberList
member.summary: Parse the separator and the possible name before it, to obtain a list of members to be shown in a member completion list.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.ParseReason.QuickInfo
member.summary: Parse the identifier or selection at the given location to obtain type information to be shown in an IntelliSense quick info tool tip.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.ParseReason.MethodTip
member.summary: Parse the method name before the current position to produce a list of all overloaded method signatures that match the method name.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.ParseReason.Autos
member.summary: Parse the code block at the given location to obtain any expressions that might be of interest in the Autos debugging window (an expression is the name of variable or parameter that can be evaluated to produce a value).

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.ParseReason.CodeSpan
member.summary: Parse the section of code containing the specified location to find the extent of the statement. Used in validating breakpoints.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.ParseReason.Goto
member.summary: Parse the identifier or expression at the specified location to obtain a possible URI of a file where the identifier is defined, declared, or referenced.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.ParseResultHandler
member.summary: Used to define a delegate for a parsing operation completion handler in a language service.
member.param: [in] A object that describes what the parsing operation did.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.TextSpanHelper
member.summary: A utility class that provides methods for manipulating and comparing instances of the class, and also for validating positions.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.TextSpanHelper.Clear(Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextManager.Interop.TextSpan@)
member.summary: Sets the members of the specified span to an empty state.
member.param: [in] The object to clear.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.TextSpanHelper.ContainsExclusive(Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextManager.Interop.TextSpan,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Determines whether the given position is contained in the given span, not including the start and end points.
member.returns: Returns true if the given position is greater than the start of the span and less than the end of the span. Returns false if the position is exactly equal to the start or end of the span or the position is outside the span.
member.param: [in] The object that is being tested against.
[in] The line index of the position to test.
[in] The column index of the position to test.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.TextSpanHelper.ContainsInclusive(Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextManager.Interop.TextSpan,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Determines whether the given position is in the span, including the start and end points.
member.returns: Returns true if the given position is greater than or equal to the start of the span and less than or equal to the end of the span. Returns false if the given position is entirely outside the span.
member.param: [in] The object that is being tested against.
[in] The line index of the position to test.
[in] The column index of the position to test.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.TextSpanHelper.EndsAfterEndOf(Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextManager.Interop.TextSpan,Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextManager.Interop.TextSpan)
member.summary: Determines whether the first span ends after the end of the second span.
member.returns: Returns true if the end of is greater than the end of ; otherwise, returns false.
member.param: [in] The first object.
[in] The second object.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.TextSpanHelper.EndsAfterStartOf(Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextManager.Interop.TextSpan,Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextManager.Interop.TextSpan)
member.summary: Determines whether the first span ends after the start of the second span.
member.returns: Returns true if the end of is greater than the start of ; otherwise, returns false.
member.param: [in] The first object.
[in] The second object.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.TextSpanHelper.EndsBeforeEndOf(Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextManager.Interop.TextSpan,Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextManager.Interop.TextSpan)
member.summary: Determines whether the first span ends before the end of the second span.
member.returns: Returns true if the end of is less than or equal to the end of ; otherwise, returns false.
member.param: [in] The first object.
[in] The second object.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.TextSpanHelper.EndsBeforeStartOf(Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextManager.Interop.TextSpan,Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextManager.Interop.TextSpan)
member.summary: Determines whether the first span ends before the start of the second span.
member.returns: Returns true if the end of is less than or equal to the start of ; otherwise, returns false.
member.param: [in] The first object.
[in] The second object.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.TextSpanHelper.Intersects(Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextManager.Interop.TextSpan,Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextManager.Interop.TextSpan)
member.summary: Determines whether the first span intersects the second span.
member.returns: Returns true if the start of is less than the end of and the end of is greater than the start of ; otherwise, returns false. Notice that the spans do not intersect if one span ends exactly where the other begins.
member.param: [in] The first object.
[in] The second object.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.TextSpanHelper.IsAfterEndOf(Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextManager.Interop.TextSpan,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Determines whether the given position occurs after the end of the given span.
member.returns: Returns true if the given position is greater than the end of the given span; otherwise, returns false.
member.param: [in] The object that is being tested against.
[in] The line index of the position to test.
[in] The column index of the position to test.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.TextSpanHelper.IsBeforeStartOf(Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextManager.Interop.TextSpan,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Determines whether the given position occurs before the start of the given span.
member.returns: Returns true if the given position is less than the start of the given span; otherwise, returns false.
member.param: [in] The object that is being tested against.
[in] The line index of the position to test.
[in] The column index of the position to test.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.TextSpanHelper.IsEmbedded(Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextManager.Interop.TextSpan,Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextManager.Interop.TextSpan)
member.summary: Determines whether the first span is wholly contained in the second span.
member.returns: Returns true if the two spans are different and the start of is equal to or greater than the start of and the end of is less than or equal to the end of ; otherwise, returns false.
member.param: [in] The first object.
[in] The second object.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.TextSpanHelper.IsEmpty(Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextManager.Interop.TextSpan)
member.summary: Determines whether the given span is empty.
member.returns: Returns true if the given span is empty; otherwise, returns false.
member.param: [in] The object that is being tested.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.TextSpanHelper.IsPositive(Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextManager.Interop.TextSpan)
member.summary: Determines whether the start of the given span occurs before the end of the span.
member.returns: Returns true if the start of the span is less than or equal to the end of the span; otherwise, returns false.
member.param: [in] The object that is being tested.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.TextSpanHelper.IsSameSpan(Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextManager.Interop.TextSpan,Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextManager.Interop.TextSpan)
member.summary: Determines whether two spans are the same.
member.returns: Returns true if the start of equals the start of and the end of equals the end of ; otherwise, returns false.
member.param: [in] The first object.
[in] The second object.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.TextSpanHelper.MakePositive(Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextManager.Interop.TextSpan@)
member.summary: Makes the given span positive.
member.param: [in] The object to be modified.

member.summary: Merges the two given spans to create a new span.
member.returns: Returns a object that is the result of merging and .

member.summary: Pins the ends of the given span to the actual line lengths in the given text buffer.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.TextSpanHelper.ValidCoord(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.Source,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Determines whether the given position is valid for the given source buffer.
member.returns: Returns true if the given position lies within the given source buffer; otherwise, returns false.
member.param: [in] A object to validate against. This can be a null value. See Remarks.
[in] The line index of the position to test.
[in] The column index of the position to test.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.TextSpanHelper.ValidSpan(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.Source,Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextManager.Interop.TextSpan)
member.summary: Determines whether the given span lies within the given source buffer.
member.returns: Returns true if the span lies entirely within the source buffer and is positive; otherwise, returns false.
member.param: [in] A object to validate against.
[in] The object representing the span to test.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.TokenColor
member.summary: Provides initial values for color indices as reported by an scanner.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.TokenColor.Text
member.summary: = 0. The default. This represents the color corresponding to the user's default text colors (the language service's list is ignored in this one case).

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.TokenColor.Keyword
member.summary: = 1. Represents the color for a language keyword (for example, "for", "if", or "else").

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.TokenColor.Comment
member.summary: = 2. Represents the color for a comment.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.TokenColor.Identifier
member.summary: = 3. Represents the color for an identifier or name (for example, a class, method, or variable name).

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.TokenColor.String
member.summary: = 4. Represents the color for a string, typically bounded by single or double quotes.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.TokenColor.Number
member.summary: = 5. Represents the color for a number (a string of decimal or hexadecimal digits).

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.TokenType
member.summary: Specifies the different types of tokens that can be identified and returned from a language service scanner.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.TokenType.Unknown
member.summary: The token is an unknown type. This is typically used for any token not recognized by the parser and should be considered an error in the code being parsed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.TokenType.Text
member.summary: General text; any text not identified as a specified token type.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.TokenType.Keyword
member.summary: A language keyword, an identifier that is reserved by the language. For example, in C#, do, while, foreach, if, and else, are all keywords.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.TokenType.Identifier
member.summary: An identifier or name. For example, the name of a variable, method, or class. In XML, this could be the name of a tag or attribute.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.TokenType.String
member.summary: A string. Typically defined as zero or more characters bounded by double quotes.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.TokenType.Literal
member.summary: A literal value (a character or number). For example, in C# or C++, this is a character bounded by single quotes, or a decimal or hexadecimal number.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.TokenType.Operator
member.summary: A punctuation character that has a specific meaning in a language. For example, in C#, arithmetic operators +, -, *, and /. In C++, pointer dereference operator ->, insertion operator >>, and extraction operation <<. In XML, assignment operator =.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.TokenType.Delimiter
member.summary: A token that operates as a separator between two language elements. For example, in C#, the period "." between class name and member name. In XML, the angle brackets surrounding a tag, < and >.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.TokenType.WhiteSpace
member.summary: A space, tab, or newline. Typically, a contiguous run of any whitespace is considered a single whitespace token. For example, the three spaces in "name this" would be treated as one whitespace token.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.TokenType.LineComment
member.summary: A line comment (comment is terminated at the end of the line). For example, in C# or C++, a comment is preceded by a //. In Visual Basic, this is a single tick '.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.TokenType.Comment
member.summary: A block comment. For example, in C# or C++, a comment is bounded by /* and */. In XML, the comment is bounded by <!-- and -->.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.TypeAndMemberDropdownBars
member.summary: Provides support for the combo boxes showing type and member information as offered by a language service.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.TypeAndMemberDropdownBars.#ctor(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.LanguageService)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: [in] A object representing the language service that uses the combo boxes.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.TypeAndMemberDropdownBars.Done
member.summary: Cleans up any allocated resources just before the object is destroyed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.TypeAndMemberDropdownBars.GetComboAttributes(System.Int32,System.UInt32@,System.UInt32@,System.IntPtr@)
member.summary: Returns information about the specified combo box.
member.returns: If successful, returns ; otherwise, returns an error code.
member.param: [in] The ID of the combo box (0 for the types combo box, 1 for the members combo box).
[out] The number of entries to be shown on the combo box.
[out] A combination of flags from the enumeration describing the type of entries to appear on the combo box.
[out] An unmarshaled handle to an object used for glyphs.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.TypeAndMemberDropdownBars.GetComboTipText(System.Int32,System.String@)
member.summary: Returns text to be shown in a tool tip when the cursor is held over the combo box.
member.returns: If successful, returns ; otherwise, returns an error code.
member.param: [in] The ID of the combo box to get the tool tip text for (0 for the types combo box, 1 for the members combo box).
[out] The text to be shown in a tool tip.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.TypeAndMemberDropdownBars.GetEntryAttributes(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.UInt32@)
member.summary: Returns the font attributes for the specified entry on the specified combo box.
member.returns: If successful, returns ; otherwise, returns an error code.
member.param: [in] The ID of the combo box (0 for the types combo box, 1 for the members combo box).
[in] The index of the entry for which to get the attributes.
[out] Returns the collection of flags from the enumeration for the requested entry.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.TypeAndMemberDropdownBars.GetEntryImage(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Returns the glyph index for the specified entry on the specified combo box.
member.returns: If successful, returns ; otherwise, returns an error code.
member.param: [in] The ID of the combo box (0 for the types combo box, 1 for the members combo box).
[in] The index of the entry for which to get the image index.
[out] Returns the index in the image list to the glyph for the specified entry. Returns -1 if there is no glyph or the entry does not exist.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.TypeAndMemberDropdownBars.GetEntryText(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String@)
member.summary: Returns the text to be displayed for the specified entry in the specified combo box.
member.returns: If successful, returns ; otherwise, returns an error code.
member.param: [in] The ID of the combo box (0 for the types combo box, 1 for the members combo box).
[in] The index of the entry for which to get the text.
[out] Returns a string containing the text to be displayed in the combo box for the specified entry. Returns null if the entry does not exist.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.TypeAndMemberDropdownBars.GetMember(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the specified entry for the specified combo box.
member.returns: If successful, returns a object describing the request entry; otherwise, returns null.
member.param: [in] The ID of the combo box (0 for the types combo box, 1 for the members combo box).
[in] The index of the entry to get.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.TypeAndMemberDropdownBars.OnComboGetFocus(System.Int32)
member.summary: Called when a combo box gets the focus.
member.returns: If successful, returns ; otherwise, returns an error code.
member.param: [in] The ID of the combo box (0 for the types combo box, 1 for the members combo box).

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.TypeAndMemberDropdownBars.OnItemChosen(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Called when an item is chosen from the specified combo box.
member.returns: If successful, returns ; otherwise, returns an error code.
member.param: [in] The ID of the combo box (0 for the types combo box, 1 for the members combo box).
[in] The index of the entry that was chosen.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.TypeAndMemberDropdownBars.OnItemSelected(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Called when an entry is highlighted in one of the combo boxes.
member.returns: If successful, returns ; otherwise, returns an error code.
member.param: [in] The ID of the combo box (0 for the types combo box, 1 for the members combo box).
[in] The index of the entry that was highlighted.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.TypeAndMemberDropdownBars.OnSynchronizeDropdowns(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.LanguageService,Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextManager.Interop.IVsTextView,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Collections.ArrayList,System.Collections.ArrayList,System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Called to fill and synchronize all combo boxes.
member.returns: If successful, returns true if the combo boxes have been changed; otherwise returns false.
member.param: [in] A object representing the language service that uses the combo boxes.
[in] An object representing the view the combo boxes are placed in and the view that shows the source file.
[in] The line number the caret is currently on.
[in] The character offset the caret is currently on.
[in, out] An of s representing the types combo box.
[in, out] An of s representing the members combo box.
[in, out] The index of the entry to be selected in the types combo box. This can also be set if the current selection is invalid.
[in, out] The index of the entry to be selected in the members combo box. This can also be set if the current selection is invalid.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.TypeAndMemberDropdownBars.SetDropdownBar(Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextManager.Interop.IVsDropdownBar)
member.summary: Called to specify the object that controls the two combo boxes.
member.returns: If successful, returns ; otherwise, returns an error code.
member.param: [in] The object that controls the two combo boxes.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.Variant.VariantType
member.summary: Specifies the type of a variant object as used by a managed package framework (MPF) language service class.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.Variant.VariantType.VT_EMPTY
member.summary: An empty variant.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.Variant.VariantType.VT_NULL
member.summary: A null value.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.Variant.VariantType.VT_I2
member.summary: A 2 byte (16-bit) signed integer.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.Variant.VariantType.VT_I4
member.summary: A 4 byte (32-bit) signed integer.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.Variant.VariantType.VT_R4
member.summary: A 4 byte real number, also known as a float.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.Variant.VariantType.VT_R8
member.summary: An 8 byte real number, also known as a double.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.Variant.VariantType.VT_CY
member.summary: A Currency value (fixed decimal point value stored in 64-bits).

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.Variant.VariantType.VT_DATE
member.summary: A DATE object.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.Variant.VariantType.VT_BSTR
member.summary: A string.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.Variant.VariantType.VT_DISPATCH
member.summary: An object that implements the interface.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.Variant.VariantType.VT_ERROR
member.summary: An error code (typically returned from a Win32 function).

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.Variant.VariantType.VT_BOOL
member.summary: A value representing true (-1) or false (0).

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.Variant.VariantType.VT_VARIANT
member.summary: A reference to a variant object.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.Variant.VariantType.VT_UNKNOWN
member.summary: An object implementing the IUnknown interface.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.Variant.VariantType.VT_DECIMAL
member.summary: A decimal number stored as a string.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.Variant.VariantType.VT_I1
member.summary: A 1 byte (8-bit) signed integer.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.Variant.VariantType.VT_UI1
member.summary: A 1 byte (8-bit) unsigned integer.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.Variant.VariantType.VT_UI2
member.summary: A 2 byte (16-bit) unsigned integer.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.Variant.VariantType.VT_UI4
member.summary: A 4 byte (32-bit) unsigned integer.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.Variant.VariantType.VT_I8
member.summary: An 8 byte (64-bit) signed integer.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.Variant.VariantType.VT_UI8
member.summary: An 8 byte (64-bit) unsigned integer.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.Variant.VariantType.VT_INT
member.summary: A generic integer (typically a 32-bit value).

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.Variant.VariantType.VT_UINT
member.summary: A generic unsigned integer (typically 32-bits).

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.Variant.VariantType.VT_VOID
member.summary: A C-style void type.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.Variant.VariantType.VT_HRESULT
member.summary: An HRESULT or COM return value.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.Variant.VariantType.VT_PTR
member.summary: A generic pointer.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.Variant.VariantType.VT_SAFEARRAY
member.summary: An array that is guaranteed to be at least empty (that is, it is never a null value).

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.Variant.VariantType.VT_CARRAY
member.summary: A C-style array (an array of pointers).

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.Variant.VariantType.VT_USERDEFINED
member.summary: A user-defined blob.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.Variant.VariantType.VT_LPSTR
member.summary: A pointer to a null-terminated ANSI string.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.Variant.VariantType.VT_LPWSTR
member.summary: A pointer to a null-terminated wide character (Unicode) string.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.Variant.VariantType.VT_FILETIME
member.summary: A value.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.Variant.VariantType.VT_BLOB
member.summary: An arbitrary block of memory.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.Variant.VariantType.VT_STREAM
member.summary: A stream of bytes.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.Variant.VariantType.VT_STORAGE
member.summary: Name of the storage.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.Variant.VariantType.VT_STREAMED_OBJECT
member.summary: A stream that contains an object.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.Variant.VariantType.VT_STORED_OBJECT
member.summary: A storage object.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.Variant.VariantType.VT_BLOB_OBJECT
member.summary: An arbitrary block of memory representing an object.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.Variant.VariantType.VT_CF
member.summary: A value specifying a clipboard format.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.Variant.VariantType.VT_CLSID
member.summary: A GUID for a class (a CLSID).

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.Variant.VariantType.VT_VECTOR
member.summary: An array with a leading count value.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.Variant.VariantType.VT_ARRAY
member.summary: An array of variants.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.Variant.VariantType.VT_BYREF
member.summary: A reference to an object.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.Variant.VariantType.VT_RESERVED
member.summary: Reserved for future use.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.Variant.VariantType.VT_ILLEGAL
member.summary: Represents an illegal variant type.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.Variant.VariantType.VT_ILLEGALMASKED
member.summary: A bit mask to isolate valid variant types.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.Variant.VariantType.VT_TYPEMASK
member.summary: A bit mask to isolate valid variant types.
